messageBody:
Testing JDBC code question:

I am currently doing inserts for database test
data in a setup() method. This is getting rather
slow to run because it runs for each test (duh).

In general, for testing JDBC code, is it more useful
to define test data in a separate SQL file that
I run beforehand? I would prefer to be able to do it
in code to make sure it's refreshed correctly before
I run (I'll forget to run the separate SQL). But, I
really want to be able to define it once for a group
of tests because they all use the same data (and
don't do any updates to cause side-effects).

Would it be reasonable to do something like this in
a constructor for the group of tests or is that taboo
because it links TestCases together?

Thanks,
Herm Greider
Lexis-Nexis
Dayton, Ohio
